newsitem.title: UK: Gun-toting British royals in trouble.
newsitem.headline: Gun-toting British royals in trouble.

text.p: Prince Charles was condemned by safety experts and the British media on Friday after he was spotted playing around with his son Harry while the 12-year-old was holding a shotgun.
The photograph of a smiling Charles lunging at Harry while on a Christmas expedition to shoot pheasants was plastered across the front pages of tabloid newspapers.
"Have You Gun Mad?" said the Daily Mirror. "Is This Any Way To Act With A Gun?" asked the Daily Mail.

The incident was the second time in a week the royal family has been attacked for their attitude to guns in a country still mourning 16 children and a teacher murdered at their school in Dunblane, Scotland, last March.
Last week Queen Elizabeth's husband, Philip, was roundly condemned for implying, while discussing the Dunblane tragedy, that guns were no more dangerous than cricket bats.
A spokesman for the British Safety Council said Charles was "absolutely stupid" to try and clip his son round the ear when he was holding a gun surrounded by other people.
"We have seen through the years that the royal family have been negligent over safety. Indulging in horseplay while carrying guns is unbelievable," he said.
The incident happened during a shoot at the royal estate at Sandringham in eastern England where the family traditionally hold their Christmas celebrations.
